title: Simple circuits - why switch does not light bulb

content.question: In the circuit shown, a battery is connected to a switch, a resistor, and a lightbulb. Which of the following provides evidence or reasoning for why the bulb will not light up whether the switch is open or closed?

choices.label: The lightbulb is farther from the battery than the resistor.
There is a permanently open circuit in the bottom right of the diagram.
The switch blocks electrons from flowing away from the batteryâ€™s negative terminal whether it is open or closed.
No charge can flow through the switch when it is open, and there is zero potential difference across the switch when it is closed.

content.answer: There is a permanently open circuit in the bottom right of the diagram.
